intro: Eurycoma latifolia, commonly known as Kacip Fatimah, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Simaroubaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is typically found in tropical rainforests, growing along riverbanks and in moist, shaded areas. Its roots and leaves are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant has also gained attention for its potential pharmacological properties.
